properties.short description: Duke William Promises his Duchy to Roger II if he should Die Childless
properties.description: According to Romuald of Salerno, Roger II extracted the promise with a substantial cash payment during an exchange that took place in Messina in 1122.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Troia Gives its Homage to Pope Honorius II
properties.description: Pope Honorius II travels to Troia at its behest and receives their homage willingly; Honorious II grants Troia various charters.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Protection of Troia by Count Rainulf
properties.description: Count Rainulf undertakes the protection of Troia against Roger II's forces.
properties.people: Rainulf II, Count of Caiazzo and Alise
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Travels to Melfi and Issues Peace
properties.description: Roger II calls his optimates to Melfi and declares peace.  He also forces Robert de Grandmesnil to declare he will "never seek to live in Apulia again."
properties.people:
Roger II, King
Robert de Grandmesnil, Lord
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Roger II Issues Privilege to Montecassino
properties.description: Roger II "confirm[ed] the donations of his predecessors as dukes" by this date.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Crescentius and Landulf Failed to Sway Benevento to Roger II
properties.description: Crescentius and Landulf fled Benevento after failing to force the city to swear fealty to Roger II.
properties.people:
Crescentius, Rector of Benevento
Landulf, Archbishop
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).

properties.short description: Anfusus Received Confraternity on This Date
properties.description: Anfusus received the confraternity from the Telese Monastery while passing by.
properties.source: The History of the Most Serene Roger, First King of Sicily in Roger II and the Creation of the Kingdom of Siclly, trans. and ed. Graham A. Loud (Manchester, Eng. and New York: Manchester University Press, 2012).
